intro: Echium lagascae, commonly known as the Canary Island thimbleweed, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, spiny calyx that resembles a thimble. The plant produces small, pale blue to violet flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Echium lagascae is adapted to arid conditions and is considered a rare and endemic species.
